physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Pain resolved and mobility improved with teriparatide treatment.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial clinical improvement with pain resolution and increased mobility was noted within the first 7 months of treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Complete healing of the pseudofracture of the right femur, and bony callus was seen on the left.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Clinical improvements continued with notable radiological evidence of increased bone mineralization.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Teriparatide treatment was stopped due to the decline in serum ALP and increase in urine PEA and serum PLP.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Biochemical deterioration was noted between 8 and 13 months of teriparatide treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Pain in the right thigh was reported, and a radiograph showed the pseudofracture of the right femur was now visible after having completely healed.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient continued to experience pain despite previously reported improvements.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Initial measurements of serum ALP prior to teriparatide were persistently low (3 to 8 IU/liter).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Indicators showed a decline in serum ALP and increases in urine PEA and serum PLP over time.
